abstract: The former C.F.O. of SkillSoft agreed to pay fines to settle accusations that he had let the company incorrectly book revenue.
snippet: The former C.F.O. of SkillSoft agreed to pay fines to settle accusations that he had let the company incorrectly book revenue.
lead_paragraph: Google’s chief legal officer and Ernst & Young’s Irish branch have settled claims that they let the executive’s former employer, SkillSoft, overstate profits, the Securities and Exchange Commission said yesterday.

headline.main: Google Officer Settles an Accounting Claim
headline.print_headline: Google Officer Settles an Accounting Claim

abstract: The search giant’s shares declined sharply in after-hours trading despite its 58 percent increase in quarterly revenues.
snippet: The search giant’s shares declined sharply in after-hours trading despite its 58 percent increase in quarterly revenues.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 19 — Sometimes what is good enough for Google is not good enough for Wall Street.

headline.main: Google Earnings Up 28% but Miss Expectations

abstract: Google says it will bid $4.6 billion for wireless spectrum…if the government imposes rules to make the wireless network open over the wishes of the telephone companies.
snippet: Google says it will bid $4.6 billion for wireless spectrum…if the government imposes rules to make the wireless network open over the wishes of the telephone companies.
lead_paragraph: Google has been asking Washington to make sure that the UHF TV frequencies that are scheduled to be auctioned off in 2009 are sold to wireless carriers who promise to make their networks open to rival services and devices. The traditional telephone companies object saying that these rules will lower the price the government gets because open networks will make less money than closed ones.
